content:
@Mario Carneiro I'm new to Lean and am trying to understand your verification of Girard's paradox. I see you used two $ s in the line
have δ ω := λ p d, d (τ ω) $ στ.2 $ λ x h, d (τ (σ x)) (στ.2 h),
and $ is notation for _ $:1 _:0 := #1 #0
Is this notation part of mathlib? Is it documented anywhere?
Could you explain what it is for?
Does
have δ ω := ...
mean
have δ := λ ω , ...
??
Thanks, Seth

oh oops I misread. That's actually have : δ ω := ... (the syntax in term mode is a little different), which is to say that it's constructing a proof of δ ω and the stuff on the right is the proof term
